items.title: Five former Colts named Semifinalists for Pro Football HoF Class of 2026
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts have five former players named among the 26 modern-era semfinalists for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s Class of 2026: running back Frank Gore, defensive end/outside linebacker Robert Mathis, quarterback Philip Rivers, placekicker Adam Vinatieri, and wide receiver Reggie Wayne. Both Gore (2015-17) and Rivers (2020) had short stints in Indianapolis, and […]

items.title: Colts make roster moves with WR Ashton Dulin missing multiple weeks with injury
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts announced on Tuesday that wide receiver Ashton Dulin (hamstring) has been placed on injured reserve, and the team signed veteran safety George Odum to the 53-man active roster from the practice squad in a corresponding roster move. The Colts also re-signed released cornerback Cameron Mitchell back to the team’s practice squad. Dulin […]

items.title: Colts’ Stock Up/Down: Week 12 @Chiefs
items.summary: Stock Up Laiatu Latu This has been Latu’s breakout year after a somewhat pedestrian rookie season. Against the Chiefs, Latu had an interception on a tipped ball […]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 443: Big Letdown from Colts in KC
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts contained the Kansas City Chiefs for much of the game but couldn't muster enough offense--or defensive stops--to prevail at Arrowhead Stadium. In this edition of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, Matt Adams recaps the game and explores where the Colts fell short.

items.title: FOX59/CBS4 sits down with Colts owner Carlie Irsay-Gordon for exclusive conversation
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Carlie Irsay-Gordon’s last six months have packed a punch. "You’re never really ready to lose a parent," said Irsay-Gordon. "It’s been sad, but honestly now I just wish he could physically be here now. I’m sure he’s very happy right now." Losing her father, Jim Irsay, has been hard, but he trained Irsay-Gordon [...]

items.title: Colts’ offense disappeared in OT loss to Chiefs: ’Not up to our standards’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Go ahead, blame the defense all you want. And there’s ample evidence. It failed to protect an 11-point fourth-quarter lead. It allowed Patrick Mahomes to spin his legendary late magic. The two-time MVP and three-time Super Bowl champion directed desperate Kansas City to Harrison Butker’s 25-yard field goal as time expired in regulation [...]

items.title: After overtime loss to Chiefs, Colts feel close but 'not there yet'
items.summary: The Colts, on both sides of the ball, came away from Sunday's loss to the Kansas City Chiefs feeling like they didn't make enough critical, high-leverage plays to beat a team with a Hall of Fame-level coach and quarterback.

items.title: Colts head coach Shane Steichen on offensive issues in Week 12 loss to Chiefs: 'It starts with me'

items.title: Charvarius Ward thought career might be over after concussion, but now ‘I feel like me again. I feel like Mooney’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Charvarius Ward didn’t need to see the video detailing events that left him with a concussion and lingering, serious symptoms that had him questioning whether he would ever play again. “I experienced it,’’ the Indianapolis Colts’ veteran cornerback said Friday. Ward called his collision with teammate Drew Ogletree freaky while each was going [...]

items.title: Colts CB Charvarius Ward Sr. on return from concussion: 'I feel like me again'
items.summary: Charvarius Ward Sr. cleared concussion protocol this week and is line to return against the Kansas City Chiefs in his first game since sustaining a concussion he described as "scary" prior to the Colts' Week 6 win over the Arizona Cardinals.

items.title: Daniel Jones, Charvarius Ward full go for Colts’ trip to Kansas City
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The quarterback and cornerback are good to go. As the Indianapolis Colts eye Sunday’s showdown with the Kansas City Chiefs in Arrowhead Stadium, they’ll have the services of Daniel Jones and Charvarius Ward. Jones was a full participant Friday’s practice after being limited Thursday when he experienced discomfort with his fibula. The Colts [...]

items.title: Colts-Chiefs preview: With Charvarius Ward Sr. back and Sauce Gardner settled in, Colts' secondary prepared for challenge of Patrick Mahomes, Andy Reid in Week 12
items.summary: Colts cornerback Charvarius Ward Sr. cleared concussion protocol, meaning he's set to play opposite Sauce Gardner against the Kansas City Chiefs in Week 12.

items.title: Daniel Jones 'ready to go' for Week 12's game vs. Kansas City Chiefs
items.summary: Jones popped up on the Colts' practice report as a limited participant in Thursday's practice, but he was a full participant Friday and will play Sunday against the Chiefs.

items.title: Colts do not rule out any players for Week 12 game vs. Kansas City Chiefs; CB Charvarius Ward Sr. clears concussion protocol
items.summary: The Colts opened Ward's 21-day window to be activated from injured reserve on Wednesday, and Ward participated in all three practices this week.
